meanings.definition: To restore to a previous condition or position
meanings.sent1: The museum reinstituted the ancient artifact to its original display case.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, the community worked together to reinstitute the fallen trees to an upright position.
meanings.sent3: The magician reinstituted the rabbit back into the hat for another trick.
meanings.sent4: The artist reinstituted the faded colors of the painting with careful restoration.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic reinstituted the engine to its former glory with expert repairs.
